CLANTYPE.NAME: GANG
CLANTYPE.SHORTDESC: ruled by a boss who assigns underlings
CLANTYPE.LONGDESC: The traditional Gang is an efficient organization run by a single boss. The boss has all the powers and authority mentioned above, and can assign lieutenants, treasurers, or staff to assist with some menial chores. Gang bosses and lieutenants also have the authority to maintain discipline in the ranks using the ORDER command.

CLANTYPE.NAME: GUILD
CLANTYPE.SHORTDESC: ruled by a numerous bosses who assign underlings
CLANTYPE.LONGDESC: The Guild is run by several elite members called Guildmasters. These guildmasters reserve many tasks for themselves, though they must often vote amongst themselves on matters affecting the good of the whole clan. The guild is very hierarchical, so that those with rank above the others may use the ORDER command to those below to maintain discipline. They may also assign a treasurer to help them handle money, though like the CLAN, the masters of the guild also reserve that authority as well.

CLANTYPE.NAME: UNION
CLANTYPE.SHORTDESC: ruled by an elected set of leaders and staff
CLANTYPE.LONGDESC: The Union is a clan where all members can vote to elect Senators to handle important decisions such as membership, interclan relations, and setting clan polity. The Senators, like the Guildmasters in a guild, must vote amongst themselves on these matters. All the union members may also vote to elect secretaries to handle clan property, treasurers to take care of money, and sheriffs to take care of military matters. In a Union, there are no members who may use the ORDER command on other members.

CLANTYPE.NAME: FELLOWSHIP
CLANTYPE.SHORTDESC: all decisions and staff are set through the vote
CLANTYPE.LONGDESC: The Fellowship is a clan where all members vote on any and all clan related matters. Interclan relations, membership, elections to office, and clan policy are able to be placed to the vote of the entire membership by any member at any time. For safety, only two powers are reserved to clan offices: the power to withdraw from the clan bank account is given only to the Treasurer, and the power to maintain clan property is given only to the Manager. Soldiers may also be appointed to handle military matters out in the field.

CLANTYPE.NAME: THEOCRACY
CLANTYPE.SHORTDESC: clerics rule, can conquer through conversion
CLANTYPE.LONGDESC: The theocracy is an organization that is always run by the highest level cleric. All other clerics enjoy second-in-command privileges. All members are required to worship the clans deity, which is the deity of the high priest. The high priest has all the powers and authority mentioned above, and can assign priests, treasurers, or crusaders to assist with some menial clan chores. All members have the authority to maintain discipline in the ranks using the ORDER command.\n\nTheocracies have a unique benefit among all other clan types. They are the only clan type that can attain conquest control points by converting the area inhabitants to their religion. They are also uniquely allowed to sanctify churches in conquered areas and hold services.

CLANTYPE.NAME: FAMILY
CLANTYPE.SHORTDESC: patron/matron rules a private group only family can join
CLANTYPE.LONGDESC: The Family is a clan that only family can join, and is ruled by either a Matron, a Patron, or both. The traditional powers of treasurer and enchanter can be held by any of the adult members of the family, which includes Misters and Mistresses. All other minor powers are held equally by all members, including the cousins, the children, and even the black sheep of the family.

CLANTYPE.NAME: ANARCHY
CLANTYPE.SHORTDESC: anyone can join, anyone can do anything
CLANTYPE.LONGDESC: The most primitive and purely human of social arrangements. Anyone can join, so there is no acceptance or rejection. Any member can perform any clan function, from moving the clan home to managing clan bank accounts. Anarchys may not, however, declare war.

CLANTYPE.NAME: PROFESSION
CLANTYPE.SHORTDESC: a clan for professions that should also grant a class to members
CLANTYPE.LONGDESC:
A simple, permanent membership clan that decides most things with votes. Use for system-based clans, and grant a class on entry.
Players must be an Apprentice to join a profession, and once in a profession, players can not gain experience outside of one.
When the Archon creates clans from this government, they should designate the clans auto-class, and make sure players only
qualify for Apprentice when creating characters.

CLANTYPE.NAME: CO-OP
CLANTYPE.SHORTDESC: neither boss can tax, order underlings, or do clan relations
CLANTYPE.LONGDESC: The Co-op is run by house mother and father, who can not engage in war or alliance with other clans, change the 10% tax rate, or order their underlings.

CLANTYPE.NAME: MERITOCRACY
CLANTYPE.SHORTDESC: ruled by those who donate the most XP to their clan
CLANTYPE.LONGDESC: The meritocracy is an hierarchical organization run by those who donate the most net XP to the clan. The ranks, from entrepreneurs down to workers, are automatically assigned by who has donated the most net XP to the clan. Members also have the authority to maintain discipline in the ranks using the ORDER command.

CLANTYPE.NAME: PLUTOCRACY
CLANTYPE.SHORTDESC: ruled by those who donate the most money to the clan
CLANTYPE.LONGDESC: The plutocracy is an hierarchical organization run by those who deposit the most net money to the clan. The ranks, from tycoons down to serfs, are automatically assigned by who has donated the most money to the clan. Members also have the authority to maintain discipline in the ranks using the ORDER command.

CLANTYPE.NAME: Corporation
CLANTYPE.SHORTDESC: A corporate entity led by the CEO.
CLANTYPE.ENTRYSCRIPT: ONCE_PROG;mpsetvar $n corporateness +1;mpsavevar $n corporateness;if var($n corporateness > 0);mptattoo $n corporate;else;endif;~

CLANTYPE.NAME: CORPORATE LAW ENFORCEMENT
CLANTYPE.SHORTDESC: A corpo-funded law enforcement with priority of protecting corporate.
CLANTYPE.ENTRYSCRIPT: ONCE_PROG;mpsetvar $n corporateness +1;mpsavevar $n corporateness;if var($n corporateness > 0);mptattoo $n corporate;else;endif;~

CLANTYPE.NAME: Colony
CLANTYPE.SHORTDESC: A militarised, strict colony or free city system

CLANTYPE.NAME: BUSINESS
CLANTYPE.ENTRYSCRIPT: ONCE_PROG;mpsetvar $n corporateness +1;mpsavevar $n corporateness;if var($n corporateness > 0);mptattoo $n corporate;else;endif;~
